Summary: Starlike rapidly moving that changed course, slowed down and then accelerated witnessed by my friend and I
trends: There have been no other sightings in Ellettsville

divs: sighting detailsmy friend who is a former commercial airline pilot(age 46) and i (age 42) were talking out in my backyard near the house at night when he looked up and asked "do you see that?". i immedaity looked up to see what looked like a shooting star rapidly moving from north\east to south\west. it looked to me to be pale white and about as bright as a bright star. my friend said it looked to have a red color. the sky was very clear. i soon realized that this moving object or light did not leave any streak, trail, or fire or smoke behind it. it did not seemt to be a meteor. it was almost straight overhead at about 80 degrees above the horizon. i then began to ask myself if this could be a sattelite although i had never seen a sattellite move anywhere near as fast as this was travelling. i think it was travelling very fast although i am not sure how larger or how high the light was. we both felt that it was high up in the atmosphere possibly in space though. about 2 seconds after looking at this i then thought " if this is someting out of the ordinary and not a sattellite then maybe it will do somehing odd". just then the light appeared to decelerate and change course to arc in a more easterly direction. it did not stop though and then seemd to accelerate and curve back to the west into its original line of flight. then it quickly faded out as it seemd to picked up speed although it was still up in the sky overhead. it was a clear sky and did not pass behind any trees. we heard no noise at any time or nor did we see any associated other lights attached to it or away from it. it did not blink or flash. neither of us could offer an explanation that seemed to fit. we both though it was definately odd. felt that it was something under some sort of controlled flight and either it was closer than we thought or was far away and if so it had moved with a high rate of speed.
